text: Charge modifiers are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, charge modifiers are added when a primary payer is created. When you move from a primary payer to the secondary/tertiary payer, the charge modifiers from the primary payer are copied to the secondary/tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied charge modifiers to anything you want. Changes to charge modifiers will persist for that payer only.

text.text: explain how Changes to charge modifiers persists for that payer only.

text: Changes to charge modifiers will persist for that payer only. For example, you can remove a GY modifier for a secondary payer that is not Medicare, and it will not affect the primary Medicare payer.

text.text: How are charge modifiers stored and managed within the ZOLL Billing system?

text: Charge modifiers are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, charge modifiers are added when a primary payer is created. When you move from a primary payer to the secondary/tertiary payer, the charge modifiers from the primary payer are copied to the secondary/tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied charge modifiers to anything you want. Changes to charge modifiers will persist for that payer only.

text.text: Could you explain the process of adding charge modifiers during claim creation?

text: During claim creation, charge modifiers are added when a primary payer is created.

text.text: What happens to charge modifiers when transitioning from a primary payer to secondary or tertiary payers?

text: When you move from a primary payer to the secondary/tertiary payer, the charge modifiers from the primary payer are copied to the secondary/tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied charge modifiers to anything you want.

text.text: Is it possible to customize charge modifiers for secondary or tertiary payers, and if so, how?

text: Yes, you can change the copied charge modifiers to anything you want. Changes to charge modifiers will persist for that payer only.

text.text: Why is it recommended to review and verify charge modifiers for each specific payer before submitting a claim?

text: It is always a good practice to check charge modifiers for the current payer before you submit the claim.
